column1: Electronystagmography is a test that looks at eye movements to see how well two nerves in the brain are working.
These nerves are: - Vestibular nerve (8th cranial nerve), which runs from the brain to the ears - Occulomotor nerve, which runs from the brain to the eyes
The test is used to determine whether a balance or nerve disorder is the cause of dizziness or vertigo.
Abnormal results may be a sign of damage to the nerve of the inner ear or other parts of the brain that control eye movements.
Any disease or injury that damages the acoustic nerve can cause vertigo.
